    level="1"
    right="Item 3"
    pfs=""
>
[Corpse Compass](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1605)
</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Outlaws of Alkenstar</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Divination" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=47" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
<trait label="Necromancy" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=117" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #180: The Smoking Gun](/Sources.aspx?ID=125) pg. 76</row>

**Price** 45 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** held in 1 hand

**Bulk** L
</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

This bone [compass](/Equipment.aspx?ID=16), made of the bones of sapient creatures that died violent deaths, is eerily effective when it comes to locating corpses. If you know you're [Tracking](/Actions.aspx?ID=66) a creature that's dead, you can use the compass's idiosyncrasies to your advantage and gain a +2 item bonus to your [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=16) check to do so. Otherwise, it works as a normal compass.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
